#text=How you take a bath varies a bit with what type of bathing facilities you have .
#text=I 'm going to describe the typical definition of a bath .
#text=Go to your tub and take the shower curtain out of the tub if it is inside it .
#text=You do n't want it to get wet !
#text=Before you close the drain you should turn on the water and let it run for a little bit so you can get it to the right temperature before you start filling the tub .
#text=If you have somewhere to store the water you can place a bucket under the warming water and use it for another purpose .
#text=Once the water coming from the tap is at the temperature you like you can place the stopper in the drain and start filling the tub .
#text=Make sure you do n't fill the tub all the way to the top because the water will displace once you get into the tub .
#text=You can also get in as the tub is filling so you can make a better judgment about when to turn off the water .
#text=While you are in the tub you should take a wash cloth and soap or bodywash to give yourself a good scrub down .
#text=If you need to wash your hair it is often better to do it after your bath .
#text=You can put the shampoo in your hair and as the tub empties place your head under the faucet to rinse out the soap .
#text=, This one was a little tough .
#text=I was n't sure how much detail to go into about taking the bath versus setting up the bath
